CAPTION FIG4.png: 'Figure 4: Showing proportion estimates by our random-effect logistic regression, for \\(k=2\\) (left) and \\(k=3\\) (right). Participants are significantly more likely to generate good ideas for the redesign ideation task when given inspirations from our analogy approach compared to baseline-surface and baseline-random approaches\n\n'
CAPTION FIG3.png: '\n\n**Figure 3: Overview and excerpts of the ideation experiment. Top-Seed product. Workers were asked to solve the same problem in a different way. Middle: Top 3 inspirations for each of the conditions. Note that the TF-IDF baseline returns results from the same domain, while our method returns a broader range of products. Bottom: Ideas generated by users exposed to the different conditions.**'
